name: Ruth Eisemann-Schier
description:
The woman pictured, Ruth Eisemann-Schier, is a pioneer.

She is a trailblazer. A groundbreaker. She is the first woman in history to make it to one of the most exclusive lists. And, yes, she is a Jew.

Eisemann-Schier was the first ever woman on FBI's Ten Most Wanted List.

How did she make it? In 1968, she and her boyfriend kidnapped an heiress for ransom. Ruth didn't stay on the list for long, as she was caught 79 days after the crime.

So let's celebrate yet another Jewish female achievement!

We kid, we kid. No one is celebrating Ruth Eisemann-Schier. It's a joke. Quit taking our website so seriously, will you?
